title: Add validation to Conan recipe that conforms with Conan.io
description:
## Problem

The GitLab Conan registry does not have the same validation in the package recipe that the Conan client is checking. This can lead to problems when working with the GitLab registry.

## Solution

Add validation on all 4 parts of the recipe: `<pkg-name>/<version>@<user>/<channel>`

The validation should match the regex `^[a-zA-Z0-9_][a-zA-Z0-9_\+\.-]{1,50}$`

## References

https://docs.conan.io/en/latest/reference/conanfile/attributes.html

## Related problems

Currently, as of 12.10, the Conan registry is only available on the instance level, requiring the `<user>` value to be the project's full `+` separated path (example `gitlab-org+gitlab`). This causes a problem in that the `user` value is limited to 50 characters but some paths are greater than 50 characters. Current behavior is that users cannot push packages with length higher than 50, so this issue will not change that behavior, but it should be addressed as soon as possible either by enabling project level access, or revisiting instance level naming restrictions. This is handled in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues/11679

title: Allow multiple screenshots to be uploaded in copy paste
description:

However, keep in mind that providing complete and relevant information early helps our product team validate the problem and start working on a solution. -->

### Problem to solve

One of the limitations of the copy/paste stack, is you can't upload multiple files via copy/paste. You can however, upload one at a time, but right now our design tab is blocking more uploads because they all go under the same filename.

See video:





### Intended users

* [Parker (Product Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#parker-product-manager)
* [Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer)
* [Presley (Product Designer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#presley-product-designer)


### Further details

Allowing multiple screenshots to be uploaded will allow more flexibility than just the one. 

### Proposal
The proposal is instead of naming copied and pasted designs `design.png` we add a timestamp to the end of the name, thus giving it a unique name which allows other designs to be copied/pasted. Something like the following:

`design_1587503757400.png` 
or
`design_jan_10_2019_12_56_17.png`

title: Updates to To-Dos record should set updated_at timestamp
description:
It appears that in the To-Do's table the created_at and updated_at dates are being set to the same value (at least for items marked as done). 

Adam investigated and discovered the following:

When the record is created the `created_at` and `updated_at` are the same. Normally when a record is updated, the `updated_at` column also changes. Unfortunately this does not happen in our codebase because we update records a bit differently, we have two cases:

* Update records in bulk (Mark all as done)
* Update individual record (Done)

Both cases are handled the same way: create an AR scope and update the `state` attribute using `update_all`.

https://apidock.com/rails/v4.0.2/ActiveRecord/Relation/update_all

It does not instantiate the involved models and it does not trigger Active Record callbacks or validations.

Related method from Gitlab: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/models/todo.rb#L108

Passing the current time would solve this issue:

```ruby
base.update_all(state: new_state, updated_at: Time.now)
```

### Proposal

- When Todo `status` changes, the `updated_at` timestamp is also changed.
- When Todo `status` is changed in bulk (by the "Mark all as done" button or "Undo mark all as done" button), the `updated_at` timestamp is the same for all affected records.

title: Duplicated records in `issue_metrics` and `merge_request_metrics` tables.
description:
### Summary

Duplicated records in `issue_metrics` and `merge_request_metrics` tables.

### Steps to reproduce

The cause is likely to be some kind of race condition. It's hard to reproduce it but happens constantly on gitlab.com (checked the DB).

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

When creating/updating merge request or issue records, we should have always one associated `metrics` record.

Example query to check duplicates:

```sql
select merge_request_id from merge_request_metrics group by merge_request_id having count(*) > 1 order by merge_request_id desc limit 10;
```
### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The example query above should return 0 items.

### Possible fixes

Ensure that we're not creating duplicated records (unique index). Migrate/dedup existing records

title: css bug: Fix alignment of the environment link on merge request
description:
How to reproduce:

1. create an empty project
2. add this to `.gitlab-ci.yml`
3. create merge request(e.g. add new file)
4. go to MR page and see

![Screen_Shot_2022-08-18_at_3.15.49_PM](/uploads/ffa0f6148f31334f1d3647dffc9c81e7/Screen_Shot_2022-08-18_at_3.15.49_PM.png)

```yaml
deploy_review:
  stage: deploy
  script:
    - echo "Deploy a review app"
  environment:
    name: review/$CI_COMMIT_REF_SLUG
    url: https://$CI_ENVIRONMENT_SLUG.example.com
    on_stop: stop_review
```

<details><summary>Original issue</summary>
![Screen_Shot_2020-04-15_at_1.21.13_PM](/uploads/a6f479e6fb290e31ec4120e3b258c490/Screen_Shot_2020-04-15_at_1.21.13_PM.png)
</details>

### Implementation Guide

Refactor the CSS used in `app/assets/javascripts/vue_merge_request_widget/components/deployment/deployment_info.vue` to ensure the sentence lines up using [GitLab UI utility classes](https://unpkg.com/browse/@gitlab/ui@43.7.1/src/scss/utilities.scss). Also remove the need for overrides in `app/assets/stylesheets/page_bundles/merge_requests.scss` surrounding `.deploy-link`.

title: Validate package versions
description:
## Summary

We should validate the package versions when a new package is persisted in the database.

Currently, there is a SemVer validation for NPM packages: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/models/packages/package.rb#L34

Here is the current situation:

| Package Type | Version field following                                                                             | Validated in GitLab | Notes                                                                                   |
|--------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Maven        | Custom. See https://docs.oracle.com/middleware/1212/core/MAVEN/maven_version.htm#MAVEN8855          | :white_check_mark:                    | Possible regexp: https://www.regextester.com/95087                                      |
| NPM          | SemVer. See https://docs.npmjs.com/about-semantic-versioning                                        | :white_check_mark:  |                                                                                         |
| NuGet        | SemVer. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/concepts/package-versioning#pre-release-versions | :white_check_mark: |                                                                                         |
| Conan        | Custom. See https://docs.conan.io/en/latest/versioning/introduction.html#version-ranges             |  :white_check_mark:                   | Done in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/29739 |
| PyPI         | Custom. See https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0440/                                               |  :white_check_mark:                    | MR: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/35080 |
| Composer | Custom. https://getcomposer.org/doc/articles/versions.md#vcs-tags-and-branches | :white_check_mark: | https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/46191  | |

## Improvements

* All package versions should be validated either using SemVer or whatever standard the package type is using.

## Risks

* This validation will occur on package creation/update.
* There is a chance that some packages can't be pushed to the GitLab Package registry anymore.
* Existing packages shouldn't encounter any issue.

## Involved components

* [`Packages::Package`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/models/packages/package.rb)


## Optional: Missing test coverage

* Improve [`package_spec.rb`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/spec/models/packages/package_spec.rb#L84) by adding examples for all package types.
* Improve the test coverage for the component responsible for package creation/update.
  * NPM: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/spec/services/packages/npm/create_package_service_spec.rb#L80

title: Remove snippets without access checks when `hard_delete` option is present
description:
Let's take a look at a chunk from the `Users::DestroyService`:

```ruby
MigrateToGhostUserService.new(user).execute unless options[:hard_delete]

response = Snippets::BulkDestroyService.new(current_user, user.snippets).execute
raise DestroyError, response.message if response.error?
```

Basically, when the option `hard_delete` is present, we don't try to migrate the associated user resources to the ghost user. This is to remove every association when the user has been reported of abuse.

Nevertheless, when we go to remove snippets we don't pass that option to the service. This means, that we will check the snippet access rights for the user (related https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/213806). That check can fail and, therefore, the user won't be removed.

Instead, what we should do is to pass the `hard_delete` option to the `Snippets::BulkDestroyService` and avoid the access right checking (we still need to remove the associated snippet repositories on disk so we still need to call this service). This way, the repository will be removed and the snippet record in the database too.

/cc @dsatcher

title: Consolidate epic tree buttons (add/create epics  and issues)
description:
### Problem to solve

We currently have two buttons the perform 4 actions in the epic tree header. Consolidating these will help reduce space needed, optimizing the tree for smaller screens. Listing all options within one button dropdown will also increase discoverability of all adding and creating options.

### Further details
This will also free up space for other options such as `expand all` and `collapse all`

### Proposal

The two `add or create` buttons are now just one dropdown button titled `Add`. When a user clicks this they are able to add or create epics or icons from the dropdown, which triggers the add or create flow we currently have for the tree.

![image](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/bd32b15e32d947094338736e2f6b5685/image.png)

### Documentation
https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/group/epics/#creating-an-epic

title: Replace jq in ci-templates
description:
### Problem to solve

The usage of [`jq`](https://stedolan.github.io/jq/) in the [`ci-templates` files](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/tree/master/includes-dev) has become [increasingly complex](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/blob/9194d1760503bc30f7d6b6df03c8b1bc96870664/includes-dev/qa-dependency_scanning.yml#L16) and difficult to maintain without [introducing bugs](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/merge_requests/53) or other unintended side effects.

### Intended users

* [Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer)
* [Simone (Software Engineer in Test)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#simone-software-engineer-in-test)

### Further details

As discussed [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/merge_requests/85#note_318857766), it's time that we revisit our usage of `jq` and investigate alternate approaches that are easier to maintain and can be tested to confirm correct operation.

### Proposal

Create a new tool to implement the `jq` logic found in the following files:

- [analyzer.yml](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/blob/9194d1760503bc30f7d6b6df03c8b1bc96870664/includes-dev/analyzer.yml#L100)
- [qa-code_quality.yml](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/blob/9194d1760503bc30f7d6b6df03c8b1bc96870664/includes-dev/qa-code_quality.yml#L10)
- [qa-container_scanning.yml](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/blob/9194d1760503bc30f7d6b6df03c8b1bc96870664/includes-dev/qa-container_scanning.yml#L12)
- [qa-dast.yml](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/blob/9194d1760503bc30f7d6b6df03c8b1bc96870664/includes-dev/qa-dast.yml#L10)
- [qa-dependency_scanning.yml](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/blob/9194d1760503bc30f7d6b6df03c8b1bc96870664/includes-dev/qa-dependency_scanning.yml#L16)
- [qa-license_management.yml](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/blob/9194d1760503bc30f7d6b6df03c8b1bc96870664/includes-dev/qa-license_management.yml#L10)
- [qa-license_scanning.yml](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/blob/9194d1760503bc30f7d6b6df03c8b1bc96870664/includes-dev/qa-license_scanning.yml#L10)
- [qa-sast.yml](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/blob/9194d1760503bc30f7d6b6df03c8b1bc96870664/includes-dev/qa-sast.yml#L16)

### Documentation

Documentation for the tool should be provided in the `README` file for the tool

### Availability & Testing

~~Add unit tests to ensure that the comparison logic is properly implemented.~~

Tests to be implemented in another issue: [Add tests for compare_reports script in ci-templates project](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/215596)

### What is the type of buyer?

~"group::composition analysis" ~"group::static analysis" ~"group::dynamic analysis"

title: Improve documentation for custom python registries
description:
### Problem to solve

~~Currently, License Compliance with a custom registry requires 2 things:~~

- ~~having a `pip.conf` file:~~
    ```conf
    [global]
    index-url = https://gitlab-airgap-pypi.us-west1-b.c.group-secure-a89fe7.internal/simple
    trusted-host = gitlab-airgap-pypi.us-west1-b.c.group-secure-a89fe7.internal
    ```
- ~~adding a `before_script` to copy that file in the right location:~~
    ```yaml
    before_script:
      - mkdir -p ~/.config/pip/
      - cp pip.conf ~/.config/pip/pip.conf
    ```
- ``configuring the `PIP_INDEX_URL` environment variable``


~~`PIP_INDEX_URL` and `pip.conf` content both declare the custom registry URL.~~

*Update*

At one point it was required to provide both a `PIP_INDEX_URL` and a `pip.conf` file. This was necessary because we didn't support the `ADDITIONAL_CA_CERT_BUNDLE` environment variable. So the only way to install packages from a custom source was to disable the TLS verification. To disable the TLS verification we had to ask codeowners to include a `pip.conf` file with a setting to disable TLS verification.

Today, we don't require TLS verification to be disabled because we support the `ADDTIONAL_CA_CERT_BUNDLE` environment variable.

### Intended users

* [Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer)
* [Devon (DevOps Engineer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#devon-devops-engineer)

### Further details

<!-- Include use cases, benefits, goals, or any other details that will help us understand the problem better. -->

### Proposal

~~We might find a way to have this information in only one place.~~

See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/214398#note_373537559

### Implementation plan

- [ ] Update documentation to indicate that disable TLS verification is dangerous and that we recommend providing a certificate chain instead. [current docs](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/922f1c422151ad104b6657180f81acb260499a86/doc/user/compliance/license_compliance/index.md#custom-root-certificates-for-python)

title: Link to line number in trace of resources scanned by DAST
description:
### Summary

When viewing the security scan on an MR, clicking the `View details` of the scanned URLs does not navigate to the line number in the trace where the scanned resources are listed.  

### Steps to reproduce

*  Create an MR for a project that includes a DAST scan. 
*  Once the DAST job is complete, in the MR's Security Scan section click `Expand`
![Screen_Shot_2020-04-15_at_9.09.05_am](/uploads/38331a6f476e18080a05096469c56fd1/Screen_Shot_2020-04-15_at_9.09.05_am.png)
*  Click the `View details` link in the DAST section
![Screen_Shot_2020-04-15_at_9.09.44_am](/uploads/d02689cacc75a81188ebdc54b7714bd8/Screen_Shot_2020-04-15_at_9.09.44_am.png)

### Example Project

https://gitlab.com/craigmsmith/craigmsmith-railsgoat-example/-/merge_requests/1

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The link goes to the bottom of the job page.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The link should go to the line number where the scanned URLs are listed. In the example project that line should be 373.

### Possible fixes

The `View details` link comes from the DAST MR endpoint `/:group/:project/-/merge_requests/:id/dast_reports`
!28849 adds the line number to the `Security::Scan` so that it might be used to build the URL with a line number.

Even if the line number is added, the line number anchor won't work until #211793 is addressed.

title: Subgroup and project milestones aren't shown on group roadmap
description: ### Summary While viewing the **[Roadmap](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/group/roadmap/)** page for a group, users are unable to see milestones created at the subgroup or project level. Only milestones created at the group level are shown. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create the following structure within a group on GitLab.com that has at least a Silver subscription applied to it: ```mermaid graph LR; A[Group]-->B[Subgroup]; B-->C[Project]; ``` 2. Create the following: - Group level milestone - Subgroup level milestone - Project level milestone 3. Set a start date and end date for all three milestones. 4. Navigate to the roadmap section of the top-level group. 5. Observe that only the group level milestone appears on the roadmap. ### Example Project - [Group](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-gold) - [Milestone](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-gold/-/milestones/7) - [Roadmap](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-gold/-/roadmap) - [Subgroup](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-gold/tristan) - [Milestone](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-gold/tristan/-/milestones/1) - [Project](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-gold/tristan/milestone) - [Milestone](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-gold/tristan/milestone/-/milestones/1) ### What is the current *bug* behavior? Only group level milestones appears on the roadmap. ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? Group level, subgroup level, and project level milestones should all display on the roadmap. ### Output of checks This bug happens on GitLab.com: 12.10.0-pre `b7c8d2dbb8f` ZD: https://gitlab.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/153431 (GitLab Internal) ### Design Figma: https://www.figma.com/file/nEx7pjtBauZY621F4G6m91/214375?node-id=0%3A1

title: Fix External issue trackers data migration
description:
In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/18639 (migration 1) we wanted to migrate data stored in the `properties` field of `services` table to data field tables (`jira_tracker_data` and `issue_tracker_data`). It, however, failed in some cases due to `attr_encrypted` issue. We fixed that issue in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/23955.

We tried to fix the data by removing the wrong values for [jira_tracker_data table](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/23621) and [issue_tracker_data table](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/23759) (migration 2) and re-schedule the migration after the fix of attr_encrypted ([migration 3](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/24076)).

Customers, however, still report problems with the issue tracker data. This is probably due to scheduling the migration 1 and running the migration 2 before the migration 1 is finished. Therefore there are still invalid data.

We should find a reliable way how to fix the issue without customers needing to re-run the migration. We also need to know the data are correct before we start with a follow-up issue where we want to start ignoring the properties field.

@engwan I know we discussed this in some issue/MR but can't find it. Maybe you have some ideas I didn't write here.

title: Epic Activity Feed Order
description:
### Problem to solve

We now have the ability to sort an issue or MRs activity to "newest first". See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/14588. Epics do not have this capability which breaks your mental model if you regularly transition between Epics and Issues. 

### Proposal

Follow the same pattern in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/14588 and add the ability for a user to sort the discussion order based on `Newest first` or `Oldest first` (current).

![Screen_Shot_2020-04-14_at_10.31.16_AM](/uploads/7a49d71967226a79647820629886c2d6/Screen_Shot_2020-04-14_at_10.31.16_AM.png)

title: Add Usage Ping tracking for Web Terminal and Pipelines in Web IDE
description:
### Problem to Solve

We currently don't have good tracking information on aggregate usage information for the Web IDE Web Terminal or the Pipelines view in the Web IDE. This makes it harder to make informed decisions about these features.

### Additional Details

We've previously done this for other features in the Web IDE as redis counters, which should be sufficient for this.

**NOTE:** This will also require an additional MR to the `version.gitlab.com` project so that it can properly receive the data.

### Proposal

Tracking should be implemented to increment a counter each time the pipelines tab is opened and each time the Web IDE Terminal is opened.

title: Create/Edit Release: make sure `(optional)` is applied to forms correctly
description:
### Problem to solve

Verify if the form fields of the Create/Edit Release need clean up to make sure `(optional)` is applied correctly.

### Intended users

* [Rachel (Release Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#rachel-release-manager)
* [Devon (DevOps Engineer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#devon-devops-engineer)
* Anyone involved in creating Releases with GitLab

### Further details

According to [Pajamas](https://design.gitlab.com/components/forms/#required-information), we default to all information being required unless stated otherwise with `(optional)` added to the label of the corresponding input field.

In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/28493#note_321302921 we discussed the `(optional)` vs `(required)` labels for the form fields of Release Assets, aka Links. We want to make sure that the Create/Edit Release form fields have the `(optional)` label added whenever necessary, so that users experience a consistent way of filling out the form. 

### Proposal

Add `* Required` to the label of the Tag field:

title: Display invoices in chronological order in the customers portal
description:
<!-- The first three sections: "Problem to solve", "Intended users" and "Proposal", are strongly recommended, while the rest of the sections can be filled out during the problem validation or breakdown phase. However, keep in mind that providing complete and relevant information early helps our product team validate the problem and start working on a solution. -->

### Problem to solve

As a user, I want to see my most recent invoice displayed first and subsequent invoices in chronological order, so I can more easily find my most recent purchases.

### Further details

Currently, the invoice list on the `View invoices` page is sorted according to purchase ID. This sorting method adds no value to the customer and isn't an intuitive way to sort a list where the date is mostly the key to finding the relevant invoice.

### Proposal

Sort the list of invoices from most recent date to oldest date.

### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

The list is sorted according to date and customers are able to find their latest invoices easily. Measured by not getting tickets from customers who can't find the invoice they are looking for.

title: Clarify security report findings in merge request widget
description:
## Problem:

In the merge request security report widget UI: findings are displayed with `x` icon, which means they are newly detected and `√` icon, which means the finding was fixed.

This is confusing since 1) it’s unclear what `x` means, as it’s not explicit in the UI with notes/key, 2) the `x`/`√` is used to denote denied/allowed licenses in the license compliance widget.

Context: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/12896 will remove this section, therefore the icons will be irrelevant. If that issue is further delayed, this is an MVC alternative for the interim.

![Screen_Shot_2020-04-14_at_1.54.06_PM](/uploads/11bfd553d691bc539151b8e56356f2a2/Screen_Shot_2020-04-14_at_1.54.06_PM.png)

## Solution ideation
 
* Remove `x` and `√` icons
* Apply explicit headers to clarify the findings
* Replace `x` (new) => `New` (header)
* `√` (fixed) => "Fixed" (header)

![new](/uploads/cf59a90a20fa96f6b3d4b0c6b91ca830/new.png)

## Implementation

### Outline

- [x] For each report within [grouped_security_reports_app.vue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/security_reports/grouped_security_reports_app.vue#L320
):
    - [x] Switch from `<issues-list>` to use a `<smart-virtual-list>` (to ensure rendering performance in case of large lists)
    - [x] Within the list display headers for `new` and `resolved` items and corresponding items (using `<report-item`) underneath
    - [x] Set `:show-report-section-status-icon="showReportSectionStatusIcon"` prop on `<report-item>`s to `false` - this prevents the default status icons from displaying 

### Tests

- [x] Add tests to ensure the correct headers and items are being rendered (currently this is not covered)

### Documentation

- [x] Update screenshots for each report time: https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/application_security/#security-scanning-tools

title: Set a deploy freeze from the API
description:
### Problem to solve It would be useful for gitlab.com full CD deployments to be able to specify windows of time when runners are paused for an environment. This has different use cases, for example: | For a regularly scheduled cron like syntax | For ad-hoc windows | | ------ | ------ | | - For teams that are not global, not as relevant to GitLab, the ability to halt CICD deployments off-hours.
- Suspend CICD pipelines on weekends when there is limited team availability. | - Special events such as big announcements, livestreams, etc.
- Holidays where there is limited team availability. | ### Intended users * [Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer) ### Proposal This is the Backend-only MVC for Deploy Freeze for environments. 1. Deploy freeze periods are specified using `cron` format, and managed via API. No UI is delivered in this MVC. 2. If a job is being processed during a freeze period, the `CI_DEPLOY_FREEZE` CI variable is set 3. Jobs which should respect the freeze period are specified with a rule, for example: ```yaml deploy_to_production: stage: deploy script: deploy_to_prod.sh rules: - if: $CI_ENVIRONMENT_FROZEN == null ``` 4. In this iteration there is no error or message, the job simply does not get created. 5. The entire pipeline must be restarted if the freeze period is over and the job should now run. Relates to #24295 ### Permissions and Security Only `Maintainer` users will be able to interact with the API endpoints.

title: Convert "Recent searches" to "Recent filters" in Analytics features
description:
### Problem to solve

While we'll change the placeholder text in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/214301, we should also:

title: Add Timestamps for when vulnerabilities are found in DAST reports
description:
### Problem to solve

As a customer who uses DAST, I want to know when, during a DAST scan, vulnerabilities are identified. This will allow me to limit my scan time when I have the data to show it stops finding significant issues after a certain amount of time. Once I have a baseline for when the majority of my vulnerabilities are found, I can safely end my scans after a set period of time instead of waiting for it to complete on its own.

### Intended users


* [Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer)
* [Sam (Security Analyst)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sam-security-analyst)

### Further details

This will help our intended users reduce pipeline run times without sacrificing proper security hygiene. This will also help us internally by giving us metrics on what we can set for sane default values for how long scans should run.

### Proposal

Much like [Add DAST vulnerability evidence to the Security Reports](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/37312) this would require capturing additional detail to be output in our gl-dast-report.json files. 


### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

Each vulnerability instance has a timestamp included with it.


### Implementation Plan

While ZAP does not store the time when an alert is raised, it does store the time when an HTTP request was sent. This is not entirely accurate, as vulnerabilities that are raised from passively scanning requests made by active scan rules will not show the correct time. 

- [ ] Return the `TIMESENTMILLIS` when querying the ZAP `HISTORY` table.
- [ ] Store the time sent in `HttpMessage`
- [ ] Update `VulnerabilityReportFormatter` to add the new field `discovered_at`, based on the time sent millis. Ensure that it is formatted as `ISO8601 UTC value with format yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss`
- [x] Update the DAST schema to include `vulnerabilities[].discovered_at`

epic.title: DAST: Better ways to work with DAST vulnerabilities

title: To-Do API should include updated_at timestamp
description:
This issue is part of the broader theme, [Embedded Analytics: To-Do & Personal Pages](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/3061).

### Problem to solve

The [public API](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/todos.html) for retrieval of To-Do List items omits the update timestamp on to-do records, those it does include created date. Happily the update values are stored in the DB, just not exposed via the API. I was hoping maybe I could scrape that from an XHR made to an internal API, but no such luck. The page is rendering a server-side template and doesn't include that metadata.

### Intended users

This may be useful to users generally but it will be especially handy to those doing research in support of the epic listed above as we will need the time at which items are closed for many important calculations. I had written a utility that consumed the API in order to collect my own data from production data for [some experimentation](gitlab#214285) but without the update timestamp, I am pretty well stuck.

### Is this a cross-stage feature?

To-Dos are the domain of ~"group::project management" overseen by @gweaver with whom we will confer as we work in this area.

title: Geo - Geo::AttachmentRegistryFinder#find_registry_differences returns wrong file type for source uploads
description:
### Summary

The query to return the source upload records in `Geo::AttachmentRegistryFinder#find_registry_differences` returns the wrong value for file type. 

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The query returns the uploader class name as the file type.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

We expected the underscored, lowercase form from the uploader class name without the Uploader suffix as the file type.

title: When deleting a project snippet, user should be redirected to the project snippets
description:
### Summary At the moment, with the Vue refactoring of the Snippet View in place, deleting a project snippet redirects a user to the personal snippets instead of the project ones. ### Steps to reproduce * Create a new Project snippet * Delete the snippet * The browser gets redirected to your personal snippets instead of the project ones ### Example Project gitlab.com ### What is the current *bug* behavior? The user gets redirected to the personal snippets instead of the project ones ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? The user should be redirected to project snippets after deleting a project snippet ### Output of checks This bug happens on GitLab.com #### Results of GitLab environment info
Expand for output related to GitLab environment info 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:env:info`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:env:info RAILS_ENV=production`)
#### Results of GitLab application Check

title: Refactor PayloadPreviewer to avoid CE/EE split in metrics_and_profiling/index.js
description:
The following discussion from !28582 should be addressed:

- [ ] @pslaughter started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/28582#note_322882005):  (+1 comment)

    > **suggestion:** To avoid future regressions caused by duplicate code, it's nice when these EE views **compose** the CE views.
    > 
    > Instead of duplicating the `.js-usage-ping` set up, we can just import the CE file.
    > 
    > ```patch
    > diff --git a/ee/app/assets/javascripts/pages/admin/application_settings/metrics_and_profiling/index.js b/ee/app/assets/javascripts/pages/admin/application_settings/metrics_and_profiling/index.js
    > index 5b246e7040e..040b4104acc 100644
    > --- a/ee/app/assets/javascripts/pages/admin/application_settings/metrics_and_profiling/index.js
    > +++ b/ee/app/assets/javascripts/pages/admin/application_settings/metrics_and_profiling/index.js
    > @@ -1,11 +1,7 @@
    >  import PayloadPreviewer from '~/pages/admin/application_settings/payload_previewer';
    > +import '~/pages/admin/application_settings/metrics_and_profiling';
    >  
    >  document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => {
    > -  new PayloadPreviewer(
    > -    document.querySelector('.js-usage-ping-payload-trigger'),
    > -    document.querySelector('.js-usage-ping-payload'),
    > -  ).init();
    > -
    >    new PayloadPreviewer(
    >      document.querySelector('.js-seat-link-payload-trigger'),
    >      document.querySelector('.js-seat-link-payload'),
    > 
    > ```
    > 
    > ---------
    > 
    > **even better:** It's not awesome that this approach creates two `DOMContentLoaded` event listeners... To improve this we can move this setup logic into a module and simply import `ee_else_ce/admin/application_settings/setup_metrics_and_profiling`.
    > 
    > Here's a patch for this:
    > 
    > [0001-Move-setup_metrics_and_profiling-to-module.patch](/uploads/1513c58e60b7c63e48eb91a9f760f9ff/0001-Move-setup_metrics_and_profiling-to-module.patch)
    > 
    > -----------
    > 
    > **it gets even better:** If we slightly change the API of `PayloadPreviewer` by looking for the container based on a dataset of the trigger, we won't even need a CE/EE split:
    > 
    > ```patch
    > diff --git a/app/assets/javascripts/pages/admin/application_settings/metrics_and_profiling/index.js b/app/assets/javascripts/pages/admin/application_settings/metrics_and_profiling/index.js
    > index d32bf6dd5b2..8c7ca5fe9c9 100644
    > --- a/app/assets/javascripts/pages/admin/application_settings/metrics_and_profiling/index.js
    > +++ b/app/assets/javascripts/pages/admin/application_settings/metrics_and_profiling/index.js
    > @@ -1,8 +1,7 @@
    >  import PayloadPreviewer from './../payload_previewer';
    >  
    >  document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => {
    > -  new PayloadPreviewer(
    > -    document.querySelector('.js-usage-ping-payload-trigger'),
    > -    document.querySelector('.js-usage-ping-payload'),
    > -  ).init();
    > +  Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.js-payload-preview-trigger')).forEach(trigger => {
    > +    new PayloadPreviewer(trigger).init();
    > +  });
    >  });
    > diff --git a/app/assets/javascripts/pages/admin/application_settings/payload_previewer.js b/app/assets/javascripts/pages/admin/application_settings/payload_previewer.js
    > index 413045d960e..42e5874be3c 100644
    > --- a/app/assets/javascripts/pages/admin/application_settings/payload_previewer.js
    > +++ b/app/assets/javascripts/pages/admin/application_settings/payload_previewer.js
    > @@ -3,9 +3,9 @@ import { __ } from '../../../locale';
    >  import flash from '../../../flash';
    >  
    >  export default class PayloadPreviewer {
    > -  constructor(trigger, container) {
    > +  constructor(trigger) {
    >      this.trigger = trigger;
    > -    this.container = container;
    > +    this.container = document.querySelector(trigger.dataset.payloadSelector);
    >      this.isVisible = false;
    >      this.isInserted = false;
    >    }
    > 
    > ```
    > 
    > IMHO, we can handle this improvement in a follow-up :smile:

title: Dependency Scanning fails for projects using python setuptools in offline mode
description:
### Main issue

This is a [sub-issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/issues/4588) for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/33720.

### Problem to solve

When scanning `setuptools` projects on offline instances with self-signed certs, the [gemnasium-python analyzer](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven) fails to scan with an SSL certificate verification error.

### Intended users

* [Delaney (Development Team Lead)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#delaney-development-team-lead)
* [Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer)
* [Devon (DevOps Engineer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#devon-devops-engineer)
* [Simone (Software Engineer in Test)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#simone-software-engineer-in-test)

### Further details

`setuptools` (unlike `pip` and `pipenv`) does not have a configuration variable in its configuration file for trusting hosts.

### Proposal

The analyzer should be updated with a `CLI_OPTS` environment flag so that users can pass the `--trusted-host <host-list>` config setting to the `setuptools` command being used to build dependencies.

### Implementation Plan

- [ ] add new env var to the analyzer and pass down to setuptools path
- [ ] add env var to dind template
- [ ] document env var 

### Permissions and Security

<!-- What permissions are required to perform the described actions? Are they consistent with the existing permissions as documented for users, groups, and projects as appropriate? Is the proposed behavior consistent between the UI, API, and other access methods (e.g. email replies)?-->

### Documentation

If this requires user setup, then we must update user documentation.

### Availability & Testing

- [ ] Test solution on the airgap-test instance:

### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

Maven projects can be successfully scanned in an offline environment.

~"GitLab Ultimate"

No.

title: Dependency Scanning fails for projects using scala in offline mode
description:
### Main issue

This is a [sub-issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/issues/4588) for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/33720.

### Problem to solve

In order to support offline environment deployments (air-gap) for Dependency Scanning on `scala sbt` projects, we need to avoid making external calls at runtime in the [gemnasium-maven analyzer](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven).

### Intended users

* [Delaney (Development Team Lead)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#delaney-development-team-lead)
* [Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer)
* [Devon (DevOps Engineer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#devon-devops-engineer)
* [Simone (Software Engineer in Test)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#simone-software-engineer-in-test)

### Further details

[gemnasium-maven analyzer](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven) tries to install the analysis plugin (`sbt-dependency-graph`) and other resources when running the analysis. This ought to be done done at build time so that the plugin is packaged with the image and doesn't need to be installed in user's scanning environment.

### Proposal

bundle all necessary requirements within the [gemnasium-maven analyzer](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven) docker image or provide a way for users to download it and make it available to the analyzer.

### Implementation Plan

title: Update breadcrumbs on "Edit Release" page to include links to main and dedicated Release pages
description:
### Problem to solve

<!-- What problem do we solve? Try to define the who/what/why of the opportunity as a user story. For example, "As a (who), I want (what), so I can (why/value)." -->

As a user, when I'm editing a Release entry, I want to be able to easily navigate back to the release overview or detail pages.

### Intended users

* [Rachel (Release Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#rachel-release-manager)

### User experience goal

<!-- What is the single user experience workflow this problem addresses? 
For example, "The user should be able to use the UI/API/.gitlab-ci.yml with GitLab to <perform a specific task>"
https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/ux/ux-research-training/user-story-mapping/ --> 

The user should be able to use the breadcrumb component to trace the path back to their original landing point when editing a Release item.

### Proposal

Update the breadcrumbs to include an entry for the project's main **Releases** page (`/-/releases`) and the Release's dedicated page (`/-/releases/<release name here>`). 

Example:

> **Nathan Friend** > **My Project** > **Releases** > **Version 16.5** > **Edit**

### Further details

When editing a Release, there is no way to get back to the Release's dedicated page (`/-/releases/<tag name here>`) or the main Releases page (`/-/releases`) using the page's breadcrumbs. The only previous entries in the breadcrumb are the project and the project's owner:

![image](/uploads/b4cd54c9393aef9b90157c77a66766e7/image.png)

The user can click the `cancel` button in the form, but that is not entirely intuitive.

Interestingly, the current behavior is consistent with other pages in our product (i.e. merge requests). I think it would make sense to update these pages with the new pattern I'm proposing above as well (in separate MRs).

It may also make sense to update these to use the `GlBreadcrumb` component from `@gitlab/ui` while we're at it. (As shown in the Pajamas documentation on breadcrumbs: https://design.gitlab.com/components/breadcrumb.)

### Permissions and Security

* [ ] Add expected impact to members with no access (0)
* [ ] Add expected impact to Guest (10) members
* [ ] Add expected impact to Reporter (20) members
* [ ] Add expected impact to Developer (30) members 
* [x] Add expected impact to Maintainer (40) members
* [x] Add expected impact to Owner (50) members

### Documentation

<!-- See the Feature Change Documentation Workflow https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/workflow.html#for-a-product-change

Documentation updates are not required. We could potentially update the releases documentation page, but this change does not add a new feature to the capability, but breadcrumbs are a native navigation pattern used across GitLab.

### Availability & Testing

* Unit test changes
* Integration test changes
* End-to-end test change

title: Update "New Tag" page to reuse the "New Release" form
description:
### Problem to solve

Once https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/214244 is completed, we will have two ways of creating Releases through the UI:

- The old **New Tags** page
- The new **New Release** page

#### New Tags page

![Screenshot_2020-08-12_at_16.25.51](/uploads/f77165ac61132da868dd5c69d510d825/Screenshot_2020-08-12_at_16.25.51.png)

![Screenshot_2020-08-12_at_16.25.58](/uploads/2baf2c71e10eb9e3bffc7dabd6fc2b15/Screenshot_2020-08-12_at_16.25.58.png)

#### New Release page

![Screenshot_2020-08-12_at_16.26.14](/uploads/c0906532eb1510c98f0917b9c1419d0b/Screenshot_2020-08-12_at_16.26.14.png)

![Screenshot_2020-08-12_at_16.26.22](/uploads/36a1089a211a991e68e31bfb8e713034/Screenshot_2020-08-12_at_16.26.22.png)

### Proposal

Update the old **New Tags** page to reuse the **New Release** form. The end result will be two pages (**New Tag** and **New Release**) that share a common implementation are _almost_ identical, except for a few small differences:

- The pages will have different URLs (`/-/tags/new` vs `/-/releases/new`), titles, and breadcrumbs
- On the **New Tag** page, the Release portion of the form will be collapsed by default. This avoids making this page too Release-focused for users who don't use Releases (or users who use tags for purposes other than Releases).

- [ ] Don't forget to clean old workarounds. Just grep for `https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/214245` in the codebase

### Intended users

* [Rachel (Release Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#rachel-release-manager)

### Background

This proposal was originally discussed in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/211692, but was broken down here into two issues:

* https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/214244
* This issue

### Permissions and Security

This page should follow existing documented permissions for both tags and Releases.

### Documentation

Yes, this change will require documentation updates. Any documentation page that involves tag creation will likely need to be updated.

title: Update "Create Release" flow to re-use the "Edit Release" form
description:
### Problem to solve

In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues/26016, we created an **Edit Release** page that allows Releases to be edited through the UI (previously, this was only possible through [the API](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/releases/#update-a-release)).

Users can also create Releases through the UI, which we made more discoverable in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/32812, but the creation experience is very different from the editing experience. Ideally, we want the creation and editing pages to be nearly identical.

### Proposal

Create a new page - a **New Release** page - that reuses the **Edit Release** form.  This will allow any enhancements made to the **Edit Release** page to automatically be available in the Release creation workflow.

#### Technical proposal

Below is a high-level technical proposal. Each bullet point represents one merge request.

- Create a new Rails route for the **New Release** page. This page should be behind a `new_release_page` feature flag
- Create a basic Vue app for this page that re-uses the existing "detail" Vuex store
- Rebuild the (current) **New tag** form into the new Vue app
- Begin reusing the **Edit Release** form on the new **New Release** page
- Update the **New Release** button on the main **Releases** page to point to this new page (again, behind the feature flag mentioned above)

### Intended users

* [Rachel (Release Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#rachel-release-manager)

### Further details

Once this change has been made, we should update the **New Tag** page to also use this new form.

### Background

This proposal was originally discussed in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/211692, but was broken down here into two issues:

- This issue
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/214245

### Permissions and Security

Only users who are able to create Releases through the API should be allowed to view the new **New Release** page.

### Documentation

We will need to add documentation about this workflow [here](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/releases/).

title: Clearer DAST error handling if incorrect parameters sent in
description:
### Problem to solve

As a DAST user, I would like errors to be surfaced with details about the problem that happened and actionable messages, so that I know how to fix it to get my DAST scan to run.

If my environment variables are not set properly or are incompatible with each other, I should receive a clear notification in my logs.


### Further details

<!-- Include use cases, benefits, goals, or any other details that will help us understand the problem better. -->
As was pointed out in an issue with running DAST in [this pipeline](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/snowplow-go-collector/pipelines/135075301), DAST error messaging does not always provide actionable information on what went wrong and how to fix it, requiring the user to search through the logs to figure out why the scan failed. MR !29388 provides a good example of how we should look at providing messages that link to the documentation, so that users can easily figure out what happened and what they need to do to fix it.
### Proposal

<!-- How are we going to solve the problem? Try to include the user journey! https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/journeys/#user-journey -->
We should look at the environment variable errors at first to see if any of those messages can be improved to surface the missing or misconfigured variable and link directly to the variable documentation.
### Permissions and Security

<!-- What permissions are required to perform the described actions? Are they consistent with the existing permissions as documented for users, groups, and projects as appropriate? Is the proposed behavior consistent between the UI, API, and other access methods (e.g. email replies)?-->

### Documentation

Update the DAST Configuration documentation to describe that `DAST_WEBSITE` or `DAST_API_SPECIFICATION` is required.

### Implementation Plan
- [x] Throw an exception that is raised when there is no `DAST_WEBSITE` or `DAST_API_SPECIFICATION`. 
- [x] Add an exception handler to DAST that deals with the exception, raising an appropriate error message when DAST is not configured correctly.
- [x] Add Remove [error handling](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/f3d6d5567e14067a654dfdafbb2dfe3ac25045f5/lib/gitlab/ci/templates/Security/DAST.gitlab-ci.yml#L28) to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/211881
- [ ] Update Coding guidelines to not use logger.error, and to instead throw an exception.

* [Parker (Product Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#parker-product-manager)

### Further details

I wish to create Epics to group issues on a theme so as to track progress on that theme over multiple milestones or releases. These Epics provide a single place for those interested in the theme to see both high level thinking about it, current progress and plans, and to make it easy others to contribute and link their ideas.

I often use the add new drop-down menu to create new issues. However, Epics are missing from this list and I often have to do quite a bit of navigating to find where they may be created. ![Screen_Shot_2020-04-13_at_10.42.51_AM](/uploads/cf6beb7d73fd0c45f2899e5a6effe930/Screen_Shot_2020-04-13_at_10.42.51_AM.png)

### Proposal

Add an option to create Epics from the create new drop-down.

### Permissions and Security

I do have access to create new Epics from the group detail page, but as I rarely use this page, it is inconvenient to navigate to it just to create the Epics.


### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

A successful implementation would allow us to create an Epic in a few clicks from any page. 
1. Click new drop-down menu in the header.
1. Click *New epic*.
1. Complete epic details and save the epic.

The current approach to an uninitiated user who knows that Epics are available is:
1. Click new drop-down menu in the header. Confusion as to why no option to create an Epic is presented.
1. Go to docs or start hunting through the application to find Epics functionality. Eventually learn that one has to go to the group page.
1. Click group drop-down.
1. Find and select the correct group.
1. Click *Epics* sidebar and select list.
1. Click *New Epic* button.
1. Complete epics details and save the epic.

### What is the type of buyer?

Epics are currently available for Premium / Silver.

### Is this a cross-stage feature?

Unknown

### Links / references

title: Vuln export CVE column sometimes had non-CVE data
description:
### Defect Description

Tested on https://staging.gitlab.com/secure-team-test/security-reports/-/security/dashboard

Sometimes CVE data is in this field.  Sometimes it has other data. 

Perhaps the column is mislabeled?

![image](/uploads/49cf8264d03e4a8b865936c0ed827471/image.png)

### Expected Behavior

* The `CVE` column should list only identifiers that have type of `cve`.
* The `CWE` column should list only identifiers that have type of `cwe`.
* The `Other Identifiers` column should list only identifiers that have type different from `cwe` or `cve`.
* Only the identifier or identifiers for a particular vulnerability appear in this column.
* All identifiers associated with a vulnerability (the `vulnerabilities.identifiers[]` array in the JSON reports) appear in this column.
   * If more than one identifier, concatenate using a delimiter unlikely to be present in any of the identifiers (for instance: `;`)

### Implementation plan

- [ ] ~backend Extend `VulnerabilityExports::Exporters::CsvService::MAPPING` (https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/7e36d346c29dbd7b884263fbccdaf9ea65281996/ee/app/services/vulnerability_exports/exporters/csv_service.rb#L16) with new fields (by adding new values to this Hash) - remember that `Other Identifiers` should return a list of `identifiers` separated by separator like `;`,
- [ ] ~backend Extend `Vulnerability` model to have new methods that will return `finding_cve`, `finding_cwe` and `finding_identifiers`

title: Investigate the possibility of using Dragonfly for Container Registry storage
description:
### Topic to Evaluate
[Dragonfly](https://d7y.io/en-us/docs/overview/what_is_dragonfly.html) is an intelligent P2P-based image and file distribution tool. It aims to improve the efficiency and success rate of file transfer and maximize the usage of network bandwidth, especially for the distribution of larget amounts of data, such as application distribution, cache distribution, log distribution, and image distribution.

At Alibaba, every month Dragonfly is invoked two billion times and distributes 3.4PB of data. Dragonfly has become one of the most important pieces of infrastructure at Alibaba.

We should evaluate if we can use this technology for the GitLab Container Registry. 

### Tasks to  Evaluate

- [ ] Determine feasibility of the feature
- [ ] Create issue for implementation or update existing implementation issue description with implementation proposal 
- [ ] Set weight on implementation issue
- [ ] If weight is greater than 5, break issue into smaller issues

### Risks and Implementation Considerations 


### Team

- [ ] Add ~"workflow::planning breakdown" ~feature and the corresponding `~devops::<stage>` and `~group::<group>` labels.
- [ ] Ping the PM and EM.

### Links
- [Dragonfly](https://d7y.io/en-us/index.html)
- [Dragonfly GitHub project](https://github.com/dragonflyoss/Dragonfly)

title: File enum-ing on local/Remote Object Storage by using group import API
description:
**[HackerOne report #848415](https://hackerone.com/reports/848415)** by `ledz1996` on 2020-04-13, assigned to @cmaxim:

### Summary

The group import API does not validate the `file` param, We could skip the param and add optional param like `file.path`  `file.remote_id`

***lib/api/group_import.rb***

```ruby  
      desc 'Create a new group import' do  
        detail 'This feature was introduced in GitLab 12.8'  
        success Entities::Group  
      end  
      params do  
        requires :path, type: String, desc: 'Group path'  
        requires :name, type: String, desc: 'Group name'  
        optional :parent_id, type: Integer, desc: "The ID of the parent group that the group will be imported into. Defaults to the current user's namespace."  
        optional 'file.path', type: String, desc: 'Path to locally stored body (generated by Workhorse)'  
        optional 'file.name', type: String, desc: 'Real filename as send in Content-Disposition (generated by Workhorse)'  
        optional 'file.type', type: String, desc: 'Real content type as send in Content-Type (generated by Workhorse)'  
        optional 'file.size', type: Integer, desc: 'Real size of file (generated by Workhorse)'  
        optional 'file.md5', type: String, desc: 'MD5 checksum of the file (generated by Workhorse)'  
        optional 'file.sha1', type: String, desc: 'SHA1 checksum of the file (generated by Workhorse)'  
        optional 'file.sha256', type: String, desc: 'SHA256 checksum of the file (generated by Workhorse)'  
      end  
      post 'import' do  
        authorize_create_group!  
        require_gitlab_workhorse!

        uploaded_file = UploadedFile.from_params(params, :file, ImportExportUploader.workhorse_local_upload_path)

        bad_request!('Unable to process group import file') unless uploaded_file

        group_params = {  
          path: params[:path],  
          name: params[:name],  
          parent_id: params[:parent_id],  
          visibility_level: closest_allowed_visibility_level,  
          import_export_upload: ImportExportUpload.new(import_file: uploaded_file)  
        }  
```

If we specify `file.path`, we would attempt to search in local file for making the importation.

***lib/uploaded_file.rb***  
```ruby  
 def self.from_params(params, field, upload_paths)  
    path = params["#{field}.path"]  
    remote_id = params["#{field}.remote_id"]  
    return if path.blank? && remote_id.blank?

    file_path = nil  
    if path  
      file_path = File.realpath(path)

      paths = Array(upload_paths) << Dir.tmpdir  
      unless self.allowed_path?(file_path, paths.compact)  
        raise InvalidPathError, "insecure path used '#{file_path}'"  
      end  
    end

    UploadedFile.new(file_path,  
      filename: params["#{field}.name"],  
      content_type: params["#{field}.type"] || 'application/octet-stream',  
      sha256: params["#{field}.sha256"],  
      remote_id: remote_id,  
      size: params["#{field}.size"])  
  end  
```

in the `allowed_path?`  function, gitlab call `exists?` first to check whether the file exists or it, because of this we could use to enum files around the system

```  
  def self.allowed_path?(file_path, paths)  
    paths.any? do |path|  
      File.exist?(path) && file_path.start_with?(File.realpath(path))  
    end  
  end  
```

Sample Request:

```  
POST /api/v4/groups/import HTTP/1.1  
Host: gitlab.example.vm  
User-Agent: curl/7.55.1  
Accept: */*  
PRIVATE-TOKEN: 8ZCeRk1-DZS1GegcVr-P  
Content-Length: 577  
Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=------------------------b4ccee868e1339da  
Connection: close

--------------------------b4ccee868e1339da  
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="name"

imporwdqted-group  
--------------------------b4ccee868e1339da  
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="file.path"

../../../../../etc/passwd  
--------------------------b4ccee868e1339da  
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="file.size"

40  
--------------------------b4ccee868e1339da  
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="file"

40c  
--------------------------b4ccee868e1339da  
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="path"

importsssed44d3-gqqroup  
--------------------------b4ccee868e1339da--

```

If the file does exists, the error returned would be "insecure path used!", if it isn't then it should be "500 Internal Error"

`/etc/passwd` attempt  
[file4.PNG](https://h1.sec.gitlab.net/a/8747a281-78d7-4935-88f2-4ebb588ce559/file4.PNG)

`/etc/passwdee` - non exists attempt  
[file3.PNG](https://h1.sec.gitlab.net/a/65e2e2ce-e74e-43c8-bb4c-f829c7de8b22/file3.PNG)

Also due to the check of ` Dir.tmpdir` the folder `/tmp` is allowed, I may leverage this to further exploitation

#### Remote Object Storage

If you specify the `file.remote_id` params, it will attempt to make connection to the remote object storage with the file key equals to the value of the params.


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a User  
2. Create an API TOKEN  
3. Follow the sample request

### Impact

System file enums, possible files in /tmp disclose

### Output of checks

This bug also happen on Gitlab.com

### Results of GitLab environment info

```

title: Slow repository pull mirroring from the same GitLab instance when using LFS.
description:
### Summary A customer recently reported that they are encountering slow repository mirroring in the same GitLab instance. They also noticed an increase in Sidekiq jobs (probably due to the slow mirroring). According to them, they experienced the problem after upgrading to GitLab 12.8.8-ee. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create a new repository (e.g. `LFS-repo`). 1. Initialize LFS, and add a large file. 1. Setup a mirror repository on the same instance (e.g. `LFS-repo-mirror`). 1. Push another LFS object to `LFS-repo`. ### Example Project (If possible, please create an example project here on GitLab.com that exhibits the problematic behavior, and link to it here in the bug report) (If you are using an older version of GitLab, this will also determine whether the bug is fixed in a more recent version) ### What is the current *bug* behavior? Slow mirroring of repository (same GitLab instance) and increased number of Sidekiq jobs. Errors in `application_json.log` ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? title: Disallow distinct count by large table foreign key
description:
As [discussed](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/29310#note_321931188) distinct counts by large foreign keys could be carefully considered.

There are several distinct_counts by `project_id` [etc](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/lib/ee/gitlab/usage_data.rb) - after I have raised similar issues to confine our distinct count to users, PMs explained that there are valid [cases](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/28316#note_314913673)

- Users have `~6M`, and projects have `13M` counts.
- Yet for larger table foreign keys such as `pipeline_id` it might be a long running process, we don't have any counters

### Solution Proposal

A rubocop rule could make sense here

title: Refactor `user_popover.vue` loading logic
description:
## Summary

<!--
Please briefly describe what part of the code base needs to be refactored.
-->

In [app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/components/user_popover/user_popover.vue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/components/user_popover/user_popover.vue)

Currently we have 3 computed properties for checking various loading states:

* `nameIsLoading`
* `workInformationIsLoading`
* `locationIsLoading`

But they could be combined into one computed property as the single source of truth is `user.loaded`

Also there is a `loaded` prop that is no longer being used and should be removed.

See threads here for more context:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/29258#note_321717498
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/29258#note_321717499
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/29258#note_321717495

## Improvements

<!--
Explain the benefits of refactoring this code.
See also https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/values/index.html#say-why-not-just-what
-->

Replace these computed properties:

* `nameIsLoading`
* `workInformationIsLoading`
* `locationIsLoading`

with 

```js
userIsLoading() {
  return !this.user.loaded
}
```

And use `userIsLoading` in the template to either show the skeleton or the data.

## Risks

<!--
Please list features that can break because of this refactoring and how you intend to solve that.
-->

User popover

## Involved components

[app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/components/user_popover/user_popover.vue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/components/user_popover/user_popover.vue)

title: Support Project configuration options in new GraphQL version Instance level Security Dashboard
description:
### Problem to solve

The Instance level dashboard currently supports configurations based on project. We need to ensure that we continue to support this existing functionality as we move to using Standalone Vulnerabilities on this dashboard.

This includes the "Edit Dashboard" button pictured here

* ![image](/uploads/0a85b62069eac8d7737ed6ae879af351/image.png)


And the "Add a project to your dashboard" view pictured here

* ![image](/uploads/7999335c00d9900f05586b41ef0e6169/image.png)


### Intended users

* [Sam (Security Analyst)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sam-security-analyst)

### Design & Experience

title: Remove period from autogenerated mutation schema and docs
description:
As seen in [this MR](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/29150/diffs#92ed8511dd4db01572827a0cf892bc13283420ec), the code for autogenerating GraphQL mutation schema and docs adds a period to the end of some descriptions.

This violates GitLab's GraphQL [styleguide](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/api_graphql_styleguide.html#description-styleguide). Let's fix it!

title: Disable the DAST spider and provide list of urls to scan
description:
<!-- The first three sections: "Problem to solve", "Intended users" and "Proposal", are strongly recommended, while the rest of the sections can be filled out during the problem validation or breakdown phase. <!-- What problem do we solve? Try to define the who/what/why of the opportunity as a user story. For example, "As a (who), I want (what), so I can (why/value)." -->
Users sometimes want to scan only a specific set of URLs, instead of having the scan spider their entire app. This would allow for more targeted, quicker scans of the application when they know the branch being scanned only applies to specific areas of the app.

### Implementation plan

- [x] `Change DAST_URLS` to `DAST_PATHS`. `DAST_PATHS` should only not include the host and should work with the `DAST_WEBSITE` to make the full URL. This will allow users to use review apps without having to reset the `DAST_URLS` in a `before_script`. [!300](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/dast/-/merge_requests/300)

title: Improve message when filtering on Security Dashboard lists no vulnerabilities results
description:
### Problem to solve

Applying filters on the Security Dashboard that result in no displayed vulnerabilities is confusing because it shows the message "No vulnerabilities for this project" - "Learn more about setting up your dashboard". This is misleading because there are still vulnerabilities; it's just that the current filter has no results to show.

### User experience goal

Provide a clear message indicating that the currently-applied filter does not match any vulnerabilities so there is nothing to show.

### Proposal

Update the empty results message for the Project, Group, and Instance-level Security Dashboards to show any time the user applies a filter that will return no results.

Proposed 

| Proposed empty state | Current empty state |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![Screen_Shot_2020-04-13_at_11.52.51_AM](/uploads/b63cb101d9cc59eb6c28429482ca2c43/Screen_Shot_2020-04-13_at_11.52.51_AM.png) |  ![Screen_Shot_2020-06-01_at_7.58.57_PM](/uploads/a8998f055e80be88fd050e0a8ee5e0d4/Screen_Shot_2020-06-01_at_7.58.57_PM.png) |


----- 

Replace only for occurrences when, in lists with one or more results, a user applies a filter that produces `0` results. 

-----

- Replace current illustration with the proposed image - [illustrations/issue](https://gitlab-org.gitlab.io/gitlab-svgs/illustrations/?q=issues)
- Replace current text with text in the image.
- Remove current call to action - no replacement needed.


### Further details

<!-- Include use cases, benefits, goals, or any other details that will help us understand the problem better. -->
Currently, the backend injects the `emptyStateSvgPath` variable and we use that path to show the svg in the error message. Since we'll need to display two different error messages based on the use case, the backend will need to provide both svg paths. Therefore, this task requires a minor backend work which could probably solved by the frontenders.

### Permissions and Security

<!-- What permissions are required to perform the described actions? Are they consistent with the existing permissions as documented for users, groups, and projects as appropriate? Is the proposed behavior consistent between the UI, API, and other access methods (e.g. email replies)?-->

title: Standalone vulnerabilities on Dependency List page - backend
description:
Sub-issue for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/214094

### Summary

Right now on Dependency List page, we have information about vulnerabilities, but it's not actionable. We need to provide a link to the standalone vulnerability page so users can interact with vulnerabilities.

### Further details

We currently parse info for the Dependency List page on-fly. That means that vulnerabilities come not from the database but from the report itself. To link the Dependency List with Standalone vulnerabilities, firstly, we need to change the way we select vulnerabilities to the Dependency List payload.

We can use the vulnerability findings stored in the DB even though they're only available for the default branch, because the Dependency List is also limited to the default branch.

For now, relationship between Occurrence and Standalone vulnerability is `1:1` and [it's not to be changed in near future](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/2652#note_371936005)

### Implementation plan

* [x] Add to `DependencyEntity::VulnerabilityEntity` field `id` (id of vulnerability) and `url` which is the path to the [vulnerability's object page](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/36739)


### Availability and Testing

SET will extend the current Dependency List End to End test to include Vulnerability verification. https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/quality/testcases/-/issues/1672

epic.title: Standalone vulnerabilities on Dependency List page

title: Prevent "GitLab Team Member" badge on comments from wrapping on mobile
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

The "GitLab Team Member" badge should be next to the username in comments. On mobile it sometimes wraps to a new line even when there is enough space.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Enable `:gitlab_employee_badge` feature flag.
   * `bin/rails console`
   * `Feature.enable(:gitlab_employee_badge)`
2. In `lib/gitlab.rb` change `self.com?` to return `true`
3. Create a user with a `@gitlab.com` email address
4. Navigate to an Issue, MR, or Epic and leave a comment
5. Resize the window to mobile

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

"GitLab Team Member" badge wraps to a new line when there is available space.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

"GitLab Team Member" badge should be next to username when there is available space.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![ios_mr_comment](/uploads/3b2315d30a8c9108564a3adc4c48922b/ios_mr_comment.png)

### Possible fixes

Float the action buttons to give the name block more space. Add `white-space: nowrap` to username and badge

description:
Our [tslint analyzer](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/tslint) installs three upstream dependencies: [typescript](https://www.npmjs.com/package/typescript), tslint, and tslint-config-security. All but tslint-config-security have had updates which need to be applied to this analyzer.

| Dependency | Current version | Latest version |

| tslint-config-security | 1.16.0 | 1.16.0 |

## Other notes

* The typescript team has officially documented an [iteration plan to get to 3.9.0](https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/37198).

title: Update sobelow analyzer to use sobelow 0.10.2
description:
Our [sobelow analyzer](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/sobelow) uses hex to install the sobelow OSS software in its Dockerfile. We're currently using v0.8.0 of that tool, however there have been a [number of versions](https://hex.pm/packages/sobelow/versions) which have come out since then. The current latest version is v0.10.2.

### v0.10.2 changes

* Bug fixes
  * Fix a format error in JSON output encoding

### v0.10.1 changes

* Bug fixes
  * Sobelow will use `.sobelow-skips` instead of `.sobelow` in your root directory for `--mark-skip-all`

### v0.10.0 changes

* Enhancements
  * Sobelow now uses `~/.sobelow/sobelow-vsn-check` for update checks
  * The `.sobelow` file in your project root is for `--mark-skip-all` only

### v0.9.3 changes

* Enhancements
  * Improved checks for all aliased functions
* Bug Fixes
  * JSON output for Raw findings is now properly normalized
  * send_download correctly flags aliased function calls
  * send_download now correctly flags piped functions

### v0.9.2 changes

* Bug Fixes
  * Fix error that resulted from redefining imported functions

### v0.9.1 changes

* Bug Fixes
  * Revert umbrella app recursion

### v0.9.0 changes

* Enhancements
  * Add --mark-skip-all and --clear-skip flags
  * New CSRF via action reuse checks
  * Sobelow can now be run in umbrella apps
* Bug Fixes
  * Fix an error when printing some kinds of variables

title: Update security-code-scan analyzer to use security-code-scan v3.5.3
description:
Our security-code-scan analyzer uses a tool provided by Microsoft to detect vulnerabilities in .Net projects. We're currently using v3.3.0 of this tool. However, [v3.5.3 has shipped](https://security-code-scan.github.io/#3.5.3). We need to update the analyzer to use the newer version.

### v3.5.3 release notes

* Removed EntityFramework “Interpolated” sinks that caused false positives.
* Added configuration entry for Web Config analyzer to allow filtering file names.

### v3.5.2 release notes

* Fix MissingMethodException `“Method not found: ‘YamlDotNet.Serialization.IDeserializer YamlDotNet.Serialization.DeserializerBuilder.Build()’” if incompatible version of YamlDotNet is loaded by the process`.

### v3.5.0 release notes

* Better taint analysis in implicit string conversions case.
* Out of range exception fix.
* New SQL injection and Path Traversal sinks.

### v3.4.0 release notes

* XSS analyzer was rewritten. Additional sanitizers were added.
* Added ReportAnalysisCompletion option to output a message that the analysis did run.
* Bugfixes and improvements.

title: Update secrets analyzer to GitLeaks v4.1.1 and TruffleHog 2.1.11
description:
Our [secrets](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/secrets) analyzer uses both [GitLeaks](https://github.com/zricethezav/gitleaks) and [TruffleHog](https://github.com/dxa4481/truffleHog). Both of these projects have had significant updates of late and need to be upped to the latest versions.

* [GitLeaks v4.1.1](https://github.com/zricethezav/gitleaks/releases/tag/v4.1.1)
* [TruffleHog v2.1.11](https://pypi.org/project/truffleHog/2.1.11/)

The biggest advantage to these updates is [increased flexibility in the detection rules for calculating entropy](https://github.com/zricethezav/gitleaks/pull/333) on the occurrences detected. This should help us better avoid false positives and calculate certainty of our findings through this analyzer.

title: Remove feature flag `ci_parallel_minutes_reset`
description:
In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/29017 we introduced `ci_parallel_minutes_reset` feature flag to parallelize the work previously done by `ClearSharedRunnersMinutesWorker`.

Given that the CI minutes reset runs once on the 1st of every month, we should not remove this feature flag earlier than 1-2 months.

title: Returning nil from a GraphQL resolver results in an exception
description:
### Summary

Returning `nil` from a GraphQL resolver _used with a connection field_ results in a `NoMethodError`.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Add a new connection field to any GraphQL type
2. Use a resolver to resolve that field
3. Ensure that the resolver's `#resolve` returns `nil`
4. From `/-/graphql-explorer`, query for that field.
5. You should see GraphQL fail with an internal server error

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Fetching a connection field that uses a resolver that returns `nil` results in a 500.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The field should return `null`.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![stacktrace of error](/uploads/e6f05b241d880ebb220a116c78304c03/Screen_Shot_2020-04-09_at_8.28.55_PM.png)

### Possible fixes

Move the authentication check for `nil` in `Gitlab::GraphQL::Authorize::AuthorizeFieldService#filter_allowed` above the check for a connection field.
